bioghist.p: Villanova University traces its origins to old Saint Augustine's Church in Philadelphia, which the Augustinians founded in 1796, and to its parish school, Saint Augustine's Academy, established in 1811. Villanova University has been sponsored by the Augustinian Order since its founding in 1842. Today, the University is comprised of five colleges: Liberal Arts and Sciences (Villanova College), Engineering, School of Business (formerly known as the College of Commerce and Finance), Nursing and the School of Law.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of photographs, negatives, and slides related to Villanova University and its campus, students, alumni, and faculty. Images of campus buildings record construction, interiors and exteriors, and documentation of buildings before and after fires. Of note are several images made by photographer James E. McClees in 1856. Events such as awards ceremonies, commencements, centennial celebrations, building dedications, and groundbreakings are also included. There are portraits of Villanova University presidents, as well as proof-books of photos of the inauguration of President Donohue and photographs of inauguration of President Dobbin. Portraits of honorary graduates include John F. Kennedy, Eugene Ormandy, Joseph Biden, James Michener, William Howard Taft, and Cardinal Jozef Glemp of Poland. Portraits of notable visitors include Martin Luther King, Jr., Gerald Ford, and Ronald Reagan. Group portraits, many of them oversized, depict faculty, trustees, and students grouped by academic major and graduating class. Student clubs and societies are also included. Other subjects include student activities, sports, theater productions, and alumni activities. Photographers include Jules Schick, Gilbert and Bacon, Harry D. Richards, William H. Rau, and Drucker and Co. Negatives in the collection include pictures of student clubs, activities, sports, candid shots of students and faculty taken for the yearbook, 1966-1967, and a series of negatives from the Engineering department, some of which appeared in the Villanova Engineer from the 1930s-1950s. The collection also includes photographs of library artwork, photographs used in exhibits and anniversary celebrations; a small number of newspaper clippings of students and faculty; and lithographs and engravings of campus views.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
